oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ramifications of System Will Extend Down to "Block Chairmen" With Assistants The discussion of further plans for the organization of the six districts of the city for the coming election of councilmen under the city manager form of government, took place at the meeting of the League of Women Vters this afternoon at the Woman's building. Mrs. W. L. Morris, president, presided and the program was in charge of Mrs. J. Marion Miller. At a previous meeting of the league the president appointed six chairmen to perfect an organization of the women in their districts. Each chairman was to appoint a vice-chairman to assist in the district organization. In making the appointments, the president was careful to alternate with republicans and democrats, so that there would not be any party feeling to possibly mar the organization. Appointments made thus far are: First district—Mrs. R. L. Cunningham, democrat, chairman. No vice-chairman has yet been announced. Second district—Miss Kate White, democrat, chairman. No vice-chairman has yet been announced.
